description: Project scaffold, status file, and packaging metadata exist
Orchestrator and dual-agent execution loop are implemented
CLI supports init, status, iterate, and add-feature flows
Local HTTP service exposes health, status, and iterate APIs
Smoke tests cover initialization and one full iteration
Zero-ask policy is persisted and applied to all agent roles
Quality gate prevents context rot before each iteration
Parallel team iteration coexists with role-based execution flow
Project can run continuous iteration loop with explicit stop decisions
System can launch browser validation and verify web flows automatically
Paper-backed design mapping is documented for loop, stop, and browser validation
Auto handoff snapshot is triggered on context/no-progress thresholds
OSWorld-style action runner supports playwright/desktop/http backends
Add dependency doctor for browser and OSWorld runtimes with actionable remediation hints
implementation_commands: Add a doctor CLI command that reports codex CLI, playwright package, and playwright browser-binary readiness in JSON and text formats.
Refactor runtime dependency checks into reusable helpers so browser validation and osworld execution share the same diagnostics.
Return structured remediation hints (for example install commands and missing-component names) instead of raw stack traces on dependency failures.

description: Add a dedicated CLI command to tune loop stop and auto-handoff thresholds
implementation_commands: Implement a set-policy command to update stop and handoff fields (max iterations, no-progress threshold, handoff thresholds, browser-stop requirement) without editing files manually.
Persist changes consistently to .caasys/policy.json and AGENT_POLICY.md and reload policy in the same process.
Add input validation and clear error messages for invalid threshold values and unsupported enum options.

description: Persist browser stop-check evidence artifacts and expose artifact paths in loop/status outputs
implementation_commands: When run-project performs browser validation at stop time, write a timestamped JSON artifact under .caasys/validation_reports/ with request, backend, result, and failure metadata.
Expose artifact path(s) in loop report payloads, AGENT_STATUS next-step context, and server API responses.
Add bounded retention (for example keep latest N artifacts) to avoid unbounded growth in long-running projects.

description: Require explicit desktop-control acknowledgement token and log OSWorld desktop actions
implementation_commands: Require both --enable-desktop-control and a deliberate acknowledgement token (for example CAASYS_DESKTOP_ACK) before desktop backend execution.
Write append-only audit entries for each desktop action (timestamp, action type, target, success/failure) to .caasys/osworld_artifacts/audit.log.
Return explicit policy-guided error output when desktop control is requested without required acknowledgements.
